title: Shell gets US Arctic oil approval
description: Royal Dutch Shell wins approval from the US Department of Interior to explore for oil in the Arctic.

title: Picasso work smashes auction record
description: Picasso's Women of Algiers becomes the most expensive painting to sell at auction, going for $179.3m at Christie's in New York.

title: Brady banned over 'Deflate-gate'
description: New England Patriots quarterback Tom Brady is suspended for four games after an inquiry into under-inflated balls.

title: Ex-CIA officer jailed for leaking
description: A judge sentences a former CIA officer to three-and-a-half years in prison for revealing classified information.

title: Tornadoes rip through southern US
description: A severe storm that hit several states has killed at least two people, injured over 43 and left missing 8 people.

title: Tsarnaev 'sorry' as defence rests
description: Anti-death penalty advocate Sister Helen Prejean says Dzhokhar Tsarnaev expressed genuine regret and sorrow over the bombings.

title: NFL's Aaron Hernandez 'shot witness'
description: Former New England Patriots player and convicted killer Aaron Hernandez is charged with witness intimidation, say prosecutors.

title: 'Success kid' raises cash for dad
description: Sam Griner, whose image spawned the 'success kid' meme, is using his fame to raise cash to pay for medical treatment for his father.

title: Tribeca festival begins in New York
description: New York's Tribeca Film Festival kicked off on Wednesday with the world premiere of Saturday Night Live documentary, Live from New York!.

title: Mississippi police accused in court
description: Four men appear in court charged over the fatal shooting of two police officers in Hattiesburg, Mississippi.

title: VIDEO: Aerial footage shows US tornado damage
description: A severe storm has rolled through the southern US, killing at least five people and leaving more than 43 injured.

title: VIDEO: US police: 'We're everyday people too'
description: The BBC spoke to former law enforcement officers at Police Week in Washington, DC to find out how they think the American public perceives them.

title: VIDEO: Obama calls mums on Mother's Day
description: President Obama marked Mother's Day in the US by calling three mums to thank them "for being great".

title: VIDEO: Black bears charge at tourists in US
description: Tourists at Yellowstone National Park in the US have been chased over a bridge by a family of black bears.

title: VIDEO: Deadly tornadoes rip across US states
description: One person has died and a number of others are missing after tornadoes, heavy winds and hail storms caused widespread damage in several American states.

title: VIDEO: VE Day marked in Washington
description: Victory in Europe day was commemorated in the US with a flypast over the Washington Memorial, featuring many original aircraft from the Second World War.

title: VIDEO: What's kept Obama away from S Dakota?
description: President Obama's visit to South Dakota now means he has visited every state in the US while serving in the White House.

title: VIDEO: Bus driver falls, nearly hits train
description: A bus driver, who was not wearing her seatbelt, fell from her seat and lost control of the vehicle, narrowly missing a freight train.

title: VIDEO: Footage shows tornado in Texas
description: Footage emerges showing a tornado touching down in Denton, Texas, as storms hit the US on Thursday, killing one and injuring at least 12 in Oklahoma.

title: Questions swirl around Bin Laden report
description: Pulitzer Prize-winning author Seymour Hersh says Osama Bin Laden operation was a joint US-Pakistani operation, raising a storm of criticism.

title: US firms add 223,000 jobs in April
description: Employers in the US created 223,000 new jobs in April, official figures show, while the unemployment rate dropped to a seven-year low of 5.4%.

title: US Fed chief warns of share 'danger'
description: Federal Reserve chief Janet Yellen told IMF managing director Christine Lagarde there are "potential dangers" in high stock market valuations.

title: Canada country profile
description: Provides an overview of Canada, including key events and facts about the world's second-largest country

title: Puerto Rico profile
description: Provides and overview as well as facts and figures for this small dependency of the United States situated in the Caribbean

title: St Pierre and Miquelon profile
description: Provides an overview of what remains of France's once-extensive possessions in North America

title: United States country profile
description: Provides an overview of the United States, including key events and facts about this superpower

title: VIDEO: Girl, 11, is youngest US chess master
description: Chess prodigy, 11, beats all comers in the US

title: Can Clinton win Democrat hat-trick?
description: History suggests a third Democrat White House win will be tough

title: Will NY derby be next great rivalry?
description: Could a New York derby be football's next great rivalry?

title: The toothy legacy of Painless Parker
description: How teeth necklaces and cocaine syringes built a dental legend

title: Canada's celebrity curry chef
description: The celebrity chef who brought posh curries to Canada

title: VIDEO: Baltimore back to 'normal'
description: Baltimore is getting back to normal - but what's normal?
